body.p: All flash writes are initiated by the Write Manager. The Write Manager receives page frame write requests from the Lookup Managers[0:1], updates the controller metadata, and issues flash write requests to the flash interface
The controller metadata is used by the Wearleveling Manager to reconstruct the FTL data structures, such as L2P table, block information, etc, in the event of an improper shutdown.

In case of multi-plane write, the Write Manager creates a chained message for a flash write request. If there is not enough data (to write even number of planes) from the Lookup Manager to perform multi-plane operation, the Write Manager inserts dummy data to complete the multi-plane operation.
Since the Write Manager is aware of how many flash writes are issued to the flash, It sends a message to the Journal Manager to initiate a snapshot write.
